data: LTC COVID - 19 Symptom Management and Therapeutics
Status

To be initiated at the time of COVID-19 diagnosis in the LTC resident, where supportive / therapeutic   measures are desired. Should comfort measures only be desired, or when end-of-life care is the primary goal, use the Long-Term Care Facility Comfort Care Orders for COVID-19

Goals of Treatment:  Ensure adequate oxygenation and hemodynamic support during acute phase of illness  Prevent complications where possible (e.g. thrombosis)  Prevent unnecessary transfer to acute care
Monitor resident clinical status, symptoms, and comfort twice per shift
None
Patient Care
Patient Isolation
T;N, Droplet and Contact, COVID-19, use appropriate eye protection
Vital Signs
T;N, BID, and as clinically required
Pulse Oximetry
T;N, BID, and as clinically required
Oxygen Therapy
T;N, Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater, Maximum 6 L/min, Nasal Cannula, SpO2 88 to 92% for diagnosed COPD
Medications
Acute Symptom Management
If on O2 at 6 L/min via nasal prongs and resident unable to maintain oxygen saturation greater than 92%, continue O2 at 6 L/min and start medications to support comfort with shortness of breath
dextromethorphan
15 mg, PO, q4h, PRN cough, drug form: oral liq
HYDROmorphone PRN range dose
dose range: 0.5 to 1 mg, PO, q4h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: tab
HYDROmorphone PRN range dose
dose range: 0.25 to 0.5 mg, subcutaneous, q4h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
acetaminophen PRN range dose
dose range: 325 to 650 mg, PO, q6h, PRN pain-mild or fever, drug form: tab
acetaminophen PRN range dose
dose range: 325 to 650 mg, rectal, q6h, PRN pain-mild or fever, drug form: supp
dimenhyDRINATE PRN range dose
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, PO, q6h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: tab
dimenhyDRINATE PRN range dose
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, rectal, q6h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: supp
dimenhyDRINATE PRN range dose
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, subcutaneous, q6h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj
LORazepam PRN range dose
dose range: 0.5 to 1 mg, sublingual, q4h, PRN anxiety, drug form: tab-sublingual
Dexamethasone is indicated for residents who are hypoxic requiring O2 supplementation secondary to COVID-19
dexamethasone
6 mg, PO, qdaily, order duration: 10 day, drug form: tab
dexamethasone
6 mg, subcutaneous, qdaily, order duration: 10 day, drug form: inj

Antibiotics are not recommended for residents with COVID-19 who do not require supplemental oxygen.  Consider antibiotics if suspected bacterial co-infection, rapidly increasing supplemental oxygen requirements, or evidence of sepsis
amoxicillin-clavulanate 875 mg-125 mg tab (dosed as amoxicillin)
875 mg, PO, BID, order duration: 5 day, drug form: tab
If eGFR less than 30 mL/min
amoxicillin-clavulanate 500 mg-125 mg tab (dosed as amoxicillin)
500 mg, PO, BID, order duration: 5 day, drug form: tab
Add azithromycin if atypical bacterial causes of pneumonia (e.g. mycoplasma chlamydophila) are strongly suspected. Caution if prolonged QTc.
azithromycin
500 mg, PO, qdaily, order duration: 3 day, drug form: tab
For severe penicillin allergy (e.g. anaphylaxis)
MOXIfloxacin
400 mg, PO, qdaily, order duration: 5 day, drug form: tab
Offer plenty of fluids as frequently as tolerated PRN. If unable to take adequate oral fluid x 24 hours, consider initiating hypodermoclysis
None
LTC Hypodermoclysis (Module)
None
For residents whom are severely ill with COVID-19, consider DVT prophylaxis
Venous Thromboembolism (VTE) Prophylaxis - Medicine (Module)
None
